00017 package WeBWorK::ContentGenerator::Login;
00018 use base qw(WeBWorK);
00019 use base qw(WeBWorK::ContentGenerator);
00020 
00021 =head1 NAME
00022 
00023 WeBWorK::ContentGenerator::Login - display a login form.
00024 
00025 =cut

00027 use strict;
00028 use warnings;
00029 #use CGI qw(-nosticky );
00030 use WeBWorK::CGI;
00031 use WeBWorK::Utils qw(readFile dequote);
00032 
00033 use mod_perl;
00034 use constant MP2 => ( exists $ENV{MOD_PERL_API_VERSION} and $ENV{MOD_PERL_API_VERSION} >= 2 );
00035 
00036 # This content generator is NOT logged in.
00037 sub if_loggedin {
00038     my ($self, $arg) = @_;
00039     
00040     return !$arg;
00041 }
00042 
00043 sub info {
00044 
00045     ######### NOTES ON TRANSLATION
00046     # -translation of the content found in the info panel.  Since most of this content is in fact read from files, a simple use of maketext would be too limited to translate these types of content efficiently.
00047 
00048     my ($self) = @_;
00049     my $r = $self->r;
00050     my $ce = $r->ce;
00051     
00052     my $result;
00053     # This section should be kept in sync with the Home.pm version
00054     # list the login info first.
00055     
00056     # FIXME this is basically the same code as below... TIME TO REFACTOR!
00057     my $login_info = $ce->{courseFiles}->{login_info};
00058 
00059     if (defined $login_info and $login_info) {
00060         # login info is relative to the templates directory, apparently
00061         $login_info = $ce->{courseDirs}->{templates} . "/$login_info";
00062         
00063         # deal with previewing a temporary file
00064         # FIXME: DANGER: this code allows viewing of any file
00065         # FIXME: this code is disabled because PGProblemEditor no longer uses editFileSuffix
00066         #if (defined $r->param("editMode") and $r->param("editMode") eq "temporaryFile"
00067         #       and defined $r->param("editFileSuffix")) {
00068         #   $login_info .= $r->param("editFileSuffix");
00069         #}
00070         
00071         if (-f $login_info) {
00072             my $text = eval { readFile($login_info) };
00073             if ($@) {
00074                 $result .= CGI::h2($r->maketext("Login Info"));
00075                 $result .= CGI::div({class=>"ResultsWithError"}, $@);
00076             } elsif ($text =~ /\S/) {
00077                 $result .= CGI::h2($r->maketext("Login Info"));
00078                 $result .= $text;
00079             }
00080         }
00081     }
00082 
00083     my $site_info = $ce->{webworkFiles}->{site_info};
00084     if (defined $site_info and $site_info) {
00085         # deal with previewing a temporary file
00086         # FIXME: DANGER: this code allows viewing of any file
00087         # FIXME: this code is disabled because PGProblemEditor no longer uses editFileSuffix
00088         #if (defined $r->param("editMode") and $r->param("editMode") eq "temporaryFile"
00089         #       and defined $r->param("editFileSuffix")) {
00090         #   $site_info .= $r->param("editFileSuffix");
00091         #}
00092         
00093         if (-f $site_info) {
00094             my $text = eval { readFile($site_info) };
00095             if ($@) {
00096                 $result .= CGI::h2($r->maketext("Site Information"));
00097                 $result .= CGI::div({class=>"ResultsWithError"}, $@);
00098             } elsif ($text =~ /\S/) {
00099                 $result .= CGI::h2($r->maketext("Site Information"));
00100                 $result .= $text;
00101             }
00102         }
00103     }
00104     
00105 
00106     
00107     if (defined $result and $result ne "") {
00108         return CGI::div({-class=>"info-wrapper"},CGI::div({class=>"info-box", id=>"InfoPanel"}, $result));
00109     } else {
00110         return "";
00111     }
00112 }
00113 
00114 sub body {
00115     my ($self) = @_;
00116     my $r = $self->r;
00117     my $ce = $r->ce;
00118     my $db = $r->db;
00119     my $urlpath = $r->urlpath;
00120 
00121     # get the authen object to make sure that we should print
00122     #    a login form or not
00123     my $auth = $r->authen;
00124     my $externalAuth = (defined($auth->{external_auth}) && $auth->{external_auth} ) ? 1 : 0;
00125     
00126     # get some stuff together
00127     my $user = $r->param("user") || "";
00128     my $key = $r->param("key");
00129     my $passwd = $r->param("passwd") || "";
00130     my $course = $urlpath->arg("courseID");
00131     my $practiceUserPrefix = $ce->{practiceUserPrefix};
00132     
00133     # don't fill in the user ID for practice users
00134     # (they should use the "Guest Login" button)
00135     $user = "" if $user =~ m/^$practiceUserPrefix/;
00136     
00137     # WeBWorK::Authen::verify will set the note "authen_error" 
00138     # if invalid authentication is found.  If this is done, it's a signal to
00139     # us to yell at the user for doing that, since Authen isn't a content-
00140     # generating module.
00141     my $authen_error = MP2 ? $r->notes->get("authen_error") : $r->notes("authen_error");
00142     if ($authen_error) {
00143         print CGI::div({class=>"ResultsWithError"},
00144             CGI::p($authen_error)
00145         );
00146     }
00147 
00148     print CGI::start_div({-class=>"p_content"});
00149     
00150     if ( $externalAuth ) {
00151         print CGI::p({}, $r->maketext("_EXTERNAL_AUTH_MESSAGE", CGI::strong($r->maketext($course))));
00152         print CGI::end_div();
00153     } else {
00154         print CGI::p($r->maketext("Please enter your username and password for [_1] below:", CGI::b($r->maketext($course))));
00155         print CGI::p($r->maketext("_LOGIN_MESSAGE", CGI::b($r->maketext("Remember Me"))));
00156         print CGI::end_div();
00157     
00158         print CGI::startform({-method=>"POST", -action=>$r->uri, -id=>"login_form"});
00159 
00160     
00161         # preserve the form data posted to the requested URI
00162         my @fields_to_print = grep { not m/^(user|passwd|key|force_passwd_authen)$/ } $r->param;
00163     
00164         #FIXME:  This next line can be removed in time.  MEG 1/27/2005
00165         # warn "Error in filtering fields : |", join("|",@fields_to_print),"|" if grep {m/user/} @fields_to_print;
00166         # the above test was an attempt to discover why "user" was 
00167         # being multiply defined.  We caught that error, but this 
00168         # warning causes trouble with UserList.pm which now has 
00169         # fields visible_users and prev_visible_users
00170     
00171     
00172         # Important note. If hidden_fields is passed an empty array 
00173         # it prints ALL parameters as hidden fields.  That is not 
00174         # what we want in this case, so we don't print at all if 
00175         # @fields_to_print is empty.
00176         print $self->hidden_fields(@fields_to_print) if @fields_to_print > 0;
00177     
00178     
00179         # print CGI::table({class=>"FormLayout"}, 
00180             # CGI::Tr([
00181                 # CGI::td([
00182                 # "Username:",
00183                 # CGI::input({-type=>"text", -name=>"user", -value=>"$user"}),
00184                 # ]),CGI::br(),
00185                 # CGI::td([
00186                 # "Password:",
00187                 # CGI::input({-type=>"password", -name=>"passwd", -value=>"$passwd"}),
00188                 # ]),CGI::br(),
00189                 # CGI::td([
00190                 # "",
00191                 # CGI::checkbox(
00192                 # -name=>"send_cookie",
00193                 # -label=>"Remember Me",
00194                 # ),
00195                 # ]),
00196             # ])
00197         # );
00198         
00199         print CGI::br(),CGI::br();
00200         print WeBWorK::CGI_labeled_input(-type=>"text", -id=>"uname", -label_text=>$r->maketext("Username").": ", -input_attr=>{-name=>"user", -value=>"$user"}, -label_attr=>{-id=>"uname_label"});
00201         print CGI::br();
00202         print WeBWorK::CGI_labeled_input(-type=>"password", -id=>"pswd", -label_text=>$r->maketext("Password").": ", -input_attr=>{-name=>"passwd", -value=>"$passwd"}, -label_attr=>{-id=>"pswd_label"});
00203         print CGI::br();
00204         print WeBWorK::CGI_labeled_input(-type=>"checkbox", -id=>"rememberme", -label_text=>$r->maketext("Remember Me"), -input_attr=>{-name=>"send_cookie", -value=>"on"});
00205         print CGI::br();
00206         print WeBWorK::CGI_labeled_input(-type=>"submit", -input_attr=>{-value=>$r->maketext("Continue")});
00207         print CGI::br();
00208         print CGI::endform();
00209     
00210         # figure out if there are any valid practice users
00211         # DBFIXME do this with a WHERE clause
00212         my @guestUserIDs = grep m/^$practiceUserPrefix/, $db->listUsers;
00213         my @GuestUsers = $db->getUsers(@guestUserIDs);
00214         my @allowedGuestUsers;
00215         foreach my $GuestUser (@GuestUsers) {
00216             next unless defined $GuestUser->status;
00217             next unless $GuestUser->status ne "";
00218             push @allowedGuestUsers, $GuestUser
00219                 if $ce->status_abbrev_has_behavior($GuestUser->status, "allow_course_access");
00220         }
00221     
00222         # form for guest login
00223         if (@allowedGuestUsers) {
00224             print CGI::startform({-method=>"POST", -action=>$r->uri});
00225         
00226             # preserve the form data posted to the requested URI
00227             my @fields_to_print = grep { not m/^(user|passwd|key|force_passwd_authen)$/ } $r->param;
00228             print $self->hidden_fields(@fields_to_print);
00229         
00230             print CGI::p($r->maketext("_GUEST_LOGIN_MESSAGE", CGI::b($r->maketext("Guest Login"))));
00231             print CGI::input({-type=>"submit", -name=>"login_practice_user", -value=>$r->maketext("Guest Login")});
00232         
00233                 print CGI::endform();
00234         }
00235     }
00236     return "";
00237 }
